member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_STATUS
member.summary: Contains information about the power status of the system.

summary.para: The AC power status. This member can be one of the following values.
The battery charge status. This member can contain one or more of the following flags.

listheader.description: High—the battery capacity is at more than 66 percent
Low—the battery capacity is at less than 33 percent
Critical—the battery capacity is at less than five percent
Unknown status—unable to read the battery flag information

summary.para: The value is zero if the battery is not being charged and the battery capacity is between low and high.

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_STATUS.BatteryLifePercent
member.summary: The percentage of full battery charge remaining. This member can be a value in the range 0 to 100, or 255 if status is unknown.

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_STATUS.SystemStatusFlag
member.summary:
The status of battery saver. To participate in energy conservation, avoid resource intensive tasks when battery saver is on. To be notified when this value changes, call the function with the power setting GUID, GUID_POWER_SAVING_STATUS.
Value Meaning
0
Battery saver is off.
1
Battery saver on. Save energy where possible.
Note This flag and the GUID_POWER_SAVING_STATUS GUID were introduced in Windows 10. This flag was previously reserved, named Reserved1, and had a value of 0.For general information about battery saver, see battery saver (in the hardware component guidelines).

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_STATUS.BatteryLifeTime
member.summary: The number of seconds of battery life remaining, or –1 if remaining seconds are unknown or if the device is connected to AC power.

member.name: SYSTEM_POWER_STATUS.BatteryFullLifeTime
member.summary: The number of seconds of battery life when at full charge, or –1 if full battery lifetime is unknown or if the device is connected to AC power.
